document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of Allodynerus Blüthgen (Hymenoptera: Vespidae: Eumeninae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Clypeus much wider than long in both female and male (Figs 39, 40); ventral side of flagellum yellow; in female, smooth area around cephalic foveae not extended to outer margin of posterior ocellus (Fig. 41); mandible normal, third tooth of mandible without one deep incision; setae at upper part of mesonotum not brush-like in lateral view; mesopleuron with dense punctures (Fig. 43); ventral sides of fore trochanter and femur with long and dense setae; tergum I (Fig. 48) wider than long, 1.43× as wide as long in dorsal view, distinctly with coarse, large and dense punctures, punctures at apex smaller and sparser; tergum II with dense punctures, punctures wholly smaller than those of tergum I, apex with one row of deeper and denser punctures forming a transverse groove, and without a bent apical lamella behind groove (Fig. 48); genitalia as in figure 45: volsella wholly narrow; penis valve as in figure 46: ventral lobe of penile valve convex laterally and basal apodeme curved from base to apex, without a bulge; basal plate of penile valve triangular, distinctly narrowed from base to apex.

Material examined.
